krns_pmdarima module

The krns_pmdarima module contains…

The KRNSPmdarima class

class kronos.models.krns_pmdarima.KRNSPmdarima(key_col: str, date_col: str, metric_col: str, fcst_col: str, train_data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], test_data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], model: typing.Optional[pmdarima.arima.arima.ARIMA] = None, m: int = 7, seasonal: bool = True)

Class to implement pm.arima.arima.ARIMA in kronos.

__init__(key_col: str, date_col: str, metric_col: str, fcst_col: str, train_data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], test_data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = Empty DataFrame Columns: [] Index: [], model: typing.Optional[pmdarima.arima.arima.ARIMA] = None, m: int = 7, seasonal: bool = True) → None

Initialization method.

Parameters

  • key_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the time series key.

  • date_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the time dimension.

  • metric_col (str) – The name of the column indicating the dimension to forecast.

  • fcst_col (str) – The name of the column indication the forecast.

  • train_data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas DataFrame with the training data.

  • test_data (pd.DataFrame) – Pandas DataFrame with the test data.

  • model (pm.arima.arima.ARIMA) – An already fitted ARIMA model, to instantiate a kronos Pmdarima from an already fitted model.

  • m (int) – The period for seasonal differencing, m refers to the number of periods in each season.

  • seasonal (bool) – Whether to fit a seasonal ARIMA.

Returns

No return.

Example

model = KRNSPmdarima(
        train_data=df_train,
        test_data=df_test,
        key_col='id',
        date_col='date',
        metric_col='y',
        fcst_col='y_hat',
        m=7,
        seasonal=True,
        model=None,
    )
fit() → None

Instantiate the model class and fit the model.

Returns

No return.

log_model(artifact_path: str) → None

Log the model artifact to mlflow.

Parameters

artifact_path (str) – Run-relative artifact path.

Returns

No return.

log_params(client: mlflow.tracking.client.MlflowClient, run_id: str) → None

Log the model params to mlflow.

Parameters

  • client (MlflowClient) – The mlflow client used to log parameters.

  • run_id (str) – The run id under which log parameters.

Returns

No return.

predict(n_days: int, fcst_first_date: datetime.date = datetime.date(2022, 5, 27)) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

Predict using the fitted model.

Parameters

  • n_days (int) – Number of data points to predict.

  • fcst_first_date (datetime.date) – First date of forecast.

Returns

(pd.DataFrame) Pandas DataFrame containing the predictions.

preprocess() → None

Get the dataframe into the condition to be processed by the model: keep only the date and metric column.

Returns

No return.
